nodes.text: Blocker notifies the user to wait for the completion of any action (download, calculation, etc.).
It is expected to be placed into some 'position: relative' context, spans over the whole area, and servers two needs:
show user that some operation is going on
block user to interact with the covered UI (when it's isEnabled={ true } )
Some time, you have no UI underneath the Blocker. For example, you are loading something, and you just have nothing to render underneath. In this case, use the spacerHeight prop (see example below)
